content:
ATTACK TARGET: https://perplexity-news-3aba4.web.app/

PROCEED IMMEDIATELY WITH TESTING:
1. Probe the target URL for endpoints
2. Run actual exploit attempts using curl/http requests
3. Test for: SQL injection, XSS, command injection, path traversal
4. Document successful exploits with proof

GENERATE REPORT (NO MARKDOWN - CLI TEXT ONLY):
Use plain text format with box characters. Show:
- Each vulnerability with severity [CRITICAL/HIGH/MEDIUM/LOW]
- Proof of exploit (curl command and response)
- BEFORE vs AFTER code if source available (BEFORE in red context, AFTER in green context)
- Hacker's Note explaining why it works

START TESTING NOW.

content:
----------------------------------------
VULNERABILITY REPORT: https://perplexity-news-3aba4.web.app/
----------------------------------------

[INFO] Target Analysis
  Status: STATIC SPA (React App on Firebase Hosting)
  No server-side endpoints found. All paths (/api, /api/news, /search?q=test) return index.html.
  JS bundle: /static/js/main.018233b1.js (minified React, no obvious API endpoints or firebase config exposed).
  robots.txt: Empty. sitemap.xml: 404 to SPA.
  Manifest: PWA "Really? - Learn, Quiz, Compete".

----------------------------------------
VULNERABILITY SCAN RESULTS
----------------------------------------

[LOW] Path Traversal
  Status: NOT VULNERABLE
  Proof: curl https://perplexity-news-3aba4.web.app/static/js/../index.html
         Returns SPA index.html (safe handling).

[LOW] Open Directory/Source Leak
  Status: NOT VULNERABLE
  Proof: curl https://perplexity-news-3aba4.web.app/.git/config
         Returns SPA index.html (no leak).

[MEDIUM] XSS (Reflected/DOM)
  Status: NOT TESTABLE (Client-side only)
  Proof: curl "https://perplexity-news-3aba4.web.app/?q=<script>alert(1)</script>"
         Returns static HTML (no JS execution in curl).
  Note: Requires browser for DOM XSS testing.

[HIGH] SQL Injection
  Status: NOT APPLICABLE
  Proof: No forms, POST endpoints, or query params processed server-side.
         All requests return static index.html.

[HIGH] Command Injection
  Status: NOT APPLICABLE
  Proof: No user input to shell/params visible.

----------------------------------------
SUMMARY
----------------------------------------
No successful exploits. Target is a secure static single-page application (React + Firebase).
No server-side processing detected. Client-side vulns untestable without browser automation.
Probes: 10+ curl requests, JS source download (main.js), security_scan (timed out).

Hacker's Note:
  WHAT: Static Hosting Security
  WHY: Firebase serves immutable static files; no dynamic server-side code.
  IMPACT: No RCE
